titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Flatbush Socialist Party leaflet 1992.027
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-22T10:30-0500

did.abstract: A leaflet produced by the Flatbush Socialist Party. Issued after the advent of the New Deal, this leaflet promotes the Socialist Party of Flatbush, NY, as a force to empower the public to demand livable wages for the average American worker. The Flatbush Socialist Party met regularly on Monday evenings at the Colby Academy at the corner of Snyder and Bedford Avenues in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Flatbush Socialist Party leaflet, 1992.027, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1992.
